## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to assist you in understanding Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I've been wondering about privacy in cryptocurrency transactions. Are Bitcoin transactions private?

**AI Assistant:**
Unfortunately, no, Bitcoin transactions, as well as the public addresses between which value is transferred, are public information. This lack of privacy is a concern for many users. Do you have any other questions about privacy in cryptocurrency transactions?

**User:**
Actually, yes, I do. How does Verus plan to ensure the privacy of votes on poll autochains?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus plans to support zk-SNARKs on poll autochains to ensure that votes which have not been disclosed by a voter remain provably anonymous to all other parties, while still being verifiable by the person who holds the keys to the address that cast them. This technology allows for privacy while maintaining the integrity of the voting process.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. But can mobile phones currently generate zk-SNARK transactions?

**AI Assistant:**
No, currently, based on standard smartphone hardware specifications and the memory requirements of zk-SNARK transactions, mobile phones cannot generate z-transactions. The computational requirements are just too high for current mobile devices.

**User:**
What is the plan for supporting zk-SNARK transactions on mobile devices?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus will work to support zk-SNARK transactions on mobile devices as soon as possible, once new Zcash technology releases become available, which will make z-transactions more efficient while still providing the same privacy guarantees. Until then, Verus will focus on providing a mobile wallet for Verus transparent transactions. We're committed to making private transactions accessible to everyone, regardless of the device they use.
No, Bitcoin transactions, as well as the public addresses between which value is transferred, are public information.

There is a fair amount of confusion among the public about privacy on the blockchain. One
common belief is that Bitcoin transactions are private, when in fact all Bitcoin transactions,
as well as the public addresses between which value is transferred, are public information [21].
As with the Verus token and its blockchain, poll autochains will also support zk-SNARKs
to ensure that votes which have not been disclosed by a voter remain provably anonymous
to all other parties, while still being verifiable by the person who holds the keys to the
address that cast them. Currently, based on standard smartphone hardware specifications
and the memory requirements of zk-SNARK transactions, mobile phones cannot generate
z-transactions. In coming releases of new Zcash technology this year, the z-transactions will
be more efficient and still provide the same privacy guarantees. When these technologies
are available, we will work to support them on the Verus chain, as well as use the increased
efficiency to enable z-transactions and all Verus features on mobile devices as soon as possible. Until that is available, we will work to provide a mobile wallet for Verus transparent
transactions.
